body.name: Dream On Me Lightweight and Compact Coast Rider Stroller with One Hand Easy Fold, Adjustable Handles and Soft Ride Wheels, Pink

byLineInfo.name: Visit the Dream On Me Store

deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 19 hrs 4 mins
features: EXPERIENCE THE WORLD: The Parent-approved Coast Rider Stroller effortlessly converts from Stroller to Scooter & Rider, offering your child a 275-degree viewing! Meeting all Disney & theme park size specs with plush seating, make this award-winner a part of all family outings.

BYE-BYE BULK: Super lightweight at just 13.5 Lbs, its aluminium frame & soft-ride wheels makes manoeuvrability a breeze. Combined with the easy one-hand fold feature that allows it to fold inward like a book in an instant, it’s a parent-loved choice.

PARENT-CONCIOUS: The innovation-driven Coast Rider Stroller comes with adjustable handles & push bars, and water-proof fabric. It can also be combined with the Coast Rider Stroller Canopy & Connector (both sold separately) for on-the-go fun time. Available in 5 finishes.

THE SAFEST CHOICE: This stroller comes a 5-point safety harness, & meets/exceeds all CPSC & ASTM standards. Winner of the 2020 JPMA Innovation Awards, 2020 National Parenting Product Awards & 2020 Baby Maternity Magazine Product of the Year Award.

WARNINGS: Weight limit: 45 Lbs. Dimensions: 28” L x 14” W x 37.5” H. Additional weight on handles could tip the stroller or the child can get entangled by a strap causing suffocation or injury. Please follow all safety protocols.
body.description: Imagine all of the perks that come with having a traditional stroller without the added bulk?! Experience the world with the JPMA Innovation Award Winner & theme-park approved, Dream On Me Coast Rider Stroller! Fondly known as the Disney (Park) stroller, this must-have checks all the boxes for baby AND parent. Lightweight at just 13.5 Lbs. yet equipped with a sturdy aluminium frame, the Coast Rider Stroller easily converts to a Scooter & Rider. The Soft-ride wheels for maneuverability, plush seating and 275-degree viewing put your child’s comfort at the forefront. This parent-loved Stroller boasts of a smooth one-hand fold feature that allows it to instantly fold inward like a book, high-quality waterproof fabric, adjustable handles & push bars. For days out in the sun or that family shopping run, combine the stroller with the Coast Rider Stroller Canopy and Coast Rider Connector (both sold separately) that turns it into a tandem travel-ready stroller in a snap! With family fun-time on the agenda, safety is our top priority. The Coast Rider Stroller comes with a 5-point safety harness and meets/exceeds all ASTM & CPSC Standards. It’s also the winner of the National Parenting Center Holiday 2019 Seal of Approval. Weight capacity: 45 Lbs. Dimensions: 28” L x 14” W x 37.5” H. Keep safety harness strapped on child at all times, do not hang diaper bags/purses on the handle bars.

Our little customers love the Coast Rider!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome little stroller for Spica Cast
reviews.reviewText: First of all, I would like to preface this with “I do NOT use this stroller as intended all the time, and anything I do I take full responsibility for in the safety of my child”.This stroller has been incredible for our family and my daughter while she spends 6 weeks in a hip spica cast. The straps are incredibly long and adjustable and they fit around her even with her sitting all the way forward to allow her legs to not have too much pressure on them while sitting. The wrap around bar and low profile seat is great for having room around her for her cast yet still keep her from tipping sideways since she is tippy from the weight of the cast. I love that you can unhook the bar from both the front and back to lift it over her head so I can lift her out easily. Technically you shouldn’t use the seat without the wrap around bar, but, I have and I do. Only when she’s sitting at a table at home playing and the breaks are on. Otherwise, it is a bit unstable, but so long as I’m supervising, we’ve had no issues. It’s got a very sturdy backrest for what it is and it’s been great for my daughters continued independence and playtime. I also bought the add-on connector bar and love it. It’s been so nice to attach to my younger daughters stroller and to a shopping cart at the store. It’s made life so much easier to go out and about and not confine my daughter to home for nearly 2 months. She can still easily go to therapy, the museum, sit at a restaurant, etc because I don’t have to deal with an overly heavy wheelchair to get in and out of our car and try to navigate that and my other daughters stroller together.It’s very light weight and folds down small, however the folding mechanism is a bit cumbersome to use to put it away. It’s finicky and hard to engage. Opening it is a breeze though, it pops up quickly and securely, often I don’t even bother folding it down, I just throw it in the car with the handle pushed down. I love the rider option with the T bar and no backrest, both of my girls can get in and out of it, even my daughter with her prosthetic leg on (before she got her cast). You do have to be careful and watch your kids when doing this, the stroller can absolutely and easily tip over if you aren’t holding it steady. I would say this is not a stroller for you if your kids are a bit too wild and like to throw their weight around. Overall though, I love this stroller, I know we will use it for a very long time because it’s great for giving my disabled daughter a spot to rest when she gets tired from her prosthetic, and we will use it again next year when she is in her spica cast again. If you’re looking for a way to avoid using a pediatric wheelchair and keep some independence, this stroller could definitely be the one for you, so long as you use caution, common sense, and ingenuity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: i love how compact it is compared to a regular bulky stroller, perfect for the aquarium when it gets crowded. i wanted to replace the umbrella stroller for something better/cooler 😆 it wheels around very easy & smooth, it could use a dual cup holder, & no storage space, only personal down side. it's sturdy as well, my child sits very comfortably, it also folds up pretty easy too. once you get it i would suggest you sit and take the time to fold it down a few times so you're not struggling in an outing. once you get the hang of it, it's cake! definitely can't have acrylics/long nails if you want it to fold down. overall obsessed. i'm not sure where the other complaints of how it falls over, unless your child just doesn't sit still (which some can't) & my child doesn't sit completely still but isn't trying to climb out. it is a seat not a jungle gym.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, Lightweight, Compact! Must Have!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this stroller in Navy through Amazon. For under $70. This Is the only one out there that will last you until a child is 5-6 years old. If your child is in the smaller side time of use will be longer! Multiple conversions allow long term use. Lightweight portability that’s compact when folded. This stroller Is all that is needed for any parent who enjoys quality for a reasonable price. Numerous easy configurations to adapt to a growing child. You will be able to push and steer with one hand. Seat covers are removable/washable. Harness style seat belts. Wheels tread smoothly. Includes a sturdy metal bar attachment with a strong Velcro belt to tandem with any existing stroller. Dream on Me has definitely exceeded my expectations. I have been able to “hack” more configurations for my 8 month old, 2 and 9 year old..(yes my 9 year old is a on the small side) . I’m positively sure that many of us parents are guilty of piling a bunch of children in one stroller for the sake of not having to make ten trips to return back to a certain area or when on a trip that requires walking all day your biggest kid refuses to walk any further....although not recommended for weight over 55lbs..I have tested this and it still pushes and turns A-OK! I have also tandem the exact same stroller using both attachments to PULL 4 children (8 mo, 2, 6, 9). The kids enjoy hanging on to the handle bar when seated or even standing in the front. You can even have one sitting and one standing! Whether you are on a quick trip or a long trip. Traveling by train, plane or automobile this stroller will be your go to. Compact, quality, and easily stowed in small areas. I have spent and upwards of $1500- $2000 for strollers believing the more money spent, equals better quality and safety. I was wrong! Waste of funds and space. This not just my BEST purchase, this is one of my SMARTEST purchase. I recommend this to ALL parents! Excellent gift for first time parents who have no clue!!
Me encantó y es muy práctica y ligera perfecta para viajes o paseos, soporta muy bien el peso de un niño de hasta 5 años, la recomiendo ampliamente.
I’m very happy with my purchase. It was meant for an upcoming trip. Very good option and purchase for my 5YO girl who doesn’t really co-operate if we go for shopping excursions.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mejor de lo que esperaba, es IDEAL para niños de 2 a 5 años
reviews.reviewText: Excelente, si lo hubiera conocido antes lo hubiera comprado al año 1 de mi hijo, hoy tiene 4 y lo usamos en viajes, Disney, aeropuertos y es una maravilla !!!

Lo que me gusto es que es para niños de más de 15kg, si te dejan transportarla hasta antes de abordar el avión, la use 1 semana en vacaciones y me fue muy útil lo único que no me gusto es que no es tan sencillo de doblar y no viene con ningún aditamento para cargarla en el hombro, se carga con 1 mano lo cual es incomoda después de un rato y no es tan ligera aprox pesa entre 7kilos, también por el precio el techo no viene incluido y en la práctica si hace falta.
